args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let X and Y be normed vector spaces over ‚Ñù. -/
variables {X Y : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup X] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù X]
  [NormedAddCommGroup Y] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù Y]

/-- If A and B are linear and bounded (continuous) operators X ‚Üí Y, then A + B is bounded. -/
theorem is_bounded_linear_map_add {A B : X ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Y} :
  IsBoundedLinearMap ‚Ñù (A : X ‚Üí Y) ‚Üí IsBoundedLinearMap ‚Ñù (B : X ‚Üí Y) ‚Üí
  IsBoundedLinearMap ‚Ñù (fun x => A x + B x) := by sorry

/-- If A is linear and bounded, then Œ± ‚Ä¢ A is bounded for any real scalar Œ±. -/
theorem is_bounded_linear_map_smul {A : X ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Y} (Œ± : ‚Ñù) :
  IsBoundedLinearMap ‚Ñù (A : X ‚Üí Y) ‚Üí IsBoundedLinearMap ‚Ñù (fun x => Œ± ‚Ä¢ A x) := by sorry

/-- The operator norm on L(X, Y) satisfies the norm axioms: nonnegativity. -/
theorem operator_norm_nonneg (f : X ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Y) : 0 ‚â§ ‚Äñf‚Äñ := by sorry

/-- Definiteness: the operator norm is zero iff the operator is the zero map. -/
theorem operator_norm_eq_zero_iff (f : X ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Y) : ‚Äñf‚Äñ = 0 ‚Üî f = 0 := by sorry

/-- Triangle inequality for the operator norm. -/
theorem operator_norm_triangle (f g : X ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Y) : ‚Äñf + g‚Äñ ‚â§ ‚Äñf‚Äñ + ‚Äñg‚Äñ := by sorry

/-- Homogeneity of the operator norm w.r.t. scalar multiplication. -/
theorem operator_norm_smul (Œ± : ‚Ñù) (f : X ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] Y) : ‚ÄñŒ± ‚Ä¢ f‚Äñ = |Œ±| * ‚Äñf‚Äñ := by sorry
